ground_truth: Neff is in the booth dialing a number and looks around to ensure he is not watched before hanging up. The LaSalle stops in front of the market, and Phyllis steps out, entering the market and looking around. Neff moves slowly along the shelves, outwardly calm but with his nerves on edge, as Phyllis approaches from beyond him, stopping beside him a couple of feet away. Phyllis moves close to him and looks at him sharply, sideways, but as a customer comes along the aisle toward them, they move apart. After the customer passes, Phyllis draws close again and takes Neff's arm, forgetting where she is, but he pulls away. Phyllis takes off her dark glasses for the first time and looks at him with cold, hard eyes, as over Neff's face, as he looks after her, comes the commentary. Neff and Lola then climb over a low hill in the foreground under a starlit sky, with music from the Bowl playing Cesar Franck's D Minor Symphony. As he helps her climb up, the camera pans with them to show the expanse of the Bowl below, filled with a packed audience and the orchestra on the lighted shell. They sit down on the grass, with Neff sitting near but not too close to her, silhouetted against the shell lights. Neff puts a cigarette in his mouth and strikes a match, glancing at her as she begins to cry. A pause follows before she starts crying again, while over Neff's face, as he listens to the music, comes the commentary. Around 5:00 P.M. or a little later, a stream of office employees comes out of an elevator into the lobby, among them Neff, wearing his hat and carrying his briefcase. As the camera precedes him walking toward the entrance doors, he is stopped by Keyes' voice off to one side. Neff stops, looks towards the cigar counter, and moves toward Keyes, who is buying cigars and stuffing them into his pockets. Keyes bites off the end of the cigar, puts it into his mouth, and starts tapping his pockets for a match, as usual. Neff strikes a match for him before Keyes goes toward the street and out of the scene. Neff moves back into the lobby, followed by the camera, and as he reaches the elevator, he looks back over his shoulder to ensure Keyes is gone, then steps into the empty elevator, stops the machine, and sits down slowly, still holding the horn. Deeply moved, Neff sits, staring blankly at the wall.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Neff is in the cubicle dialing a numeral and glances around to confirm he is not observed before hanging up. The LaSalle halts in front of the marketplace, and Phyllis alights, entering the marketplace and glancing around. Neff advances slowly along the racks, outwardly composed but with his nerves taut, as Phyllis approaches from beyond him, pausing beside him a pair of feet away. Phyllis moves close to him and glances at him sharply, sideways, but as a patron comes along the lane toward them, they move apart. After the patron passes, Phyllis draws close again and grips Neff's arm, forgetting where she is, but he withdraws. Phyllis removes her dark spectacles for the first time and glances at him with cold, hard eyes, as over Neff's visage, as he gazes after her, comes the narration. Neff and Lola then ascend over a low mound in the foreground under a starlit sky, with melodies from the Bowl playing Cesar Franck's D Minor Symphony. As he assists her climb up, the camera pans with them to show the expanse of the Bowl below, filled with a packed audience and the orchestra on the illuminated shell. They settle down on the grass, with Neff sitting near but not too close to her, silhouetted against the shell lights. Neff places a cigarette in his lips and strikes a match, glancing at her as she begins to weep. A pause follows before she starts weeping again, while over Neff's visage, as he listens to the melodies, comes the narration. Around 5:00 P.M. or a little later, a stream of office workers emerges from an elevator into the lobby, among them Neff, wearing his hat and carrying his briefcase. As the camera precedes him walking toward the entry doors, he is halted by Keyes' voice off to one side. Neff stops, glances towards the cigar counter, and moves toward Keyes, who is purchasing cigars and stuffing them into his pockets. Keyes bites off the tip of the cigar, places it into his lips, and starts tapping his pockets for a match, as usual. Neff strikes a match for him before Keyes goes toward the thoroughfare and out of the scene. Neff moves back into the lobby, followed by the camera, and as he reaches the elevator, he glances back over his shoulder to confirm Keyes is gone, then steps into the vacant elevator, halts the mechanism, and sits down slowly, still holding the horn. Deeply affected, Neff sits, staring blankly at the wall.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Neff is in the booth dialing a number, and he looks around to ensure he is not being watched before hanging up. The market is stopped in front of by the LaSalle, and Phyllis steps out, entering the market and looking around. The shelves are moved along slowly by Neff, outwardly calm but with his nerves on edge, as Phyllis approaches from beyond him, stopping beside him a couple of feet away. Neff is moved close to by Phyllis, and she looks at him sharply, sideways, but as a customer comes along the aisle toward them, they move apart. After the customer passes, Phyllis draws close again, and Neff's arm is taken by her, forgetting where she is, but he pulls away. Her dark glasses are taken off by Phyllis for the first time, and with cold, hard eyes, she looks at him, as commentary comes over Neff's face, as he looks after her. Neff and Lola then climb over a low hill in the foreground under a starlit sky, with music from the Bowl playing Cesar Franck's D Minor Symphony. Lola is helped up by him, and the camera pans with them to show the expanse of the Bowl below, filled with a packed audience and the orchestra on the lighted shell. The grass is sat down on by them, with Neff sitting near but not too close to her, silhouetted against the shell lights. A cigarette is put in his mouth by Neff, and he strikes a match, glancing at her as she begins to cry. A pause follows before she starts crying again, while commentary comes over Neff's face, as he listens to the music. Around 5:00 P.M. or a little later, an elevator stream of office employees comes out into the lobby, among them Neff, wearing his hat and carrying his briefcase. As the camera precedes him walking toward the entrance doors, Keyes' voice off to one side stops him. Keyes is looked towards by Neff, and he moves toward the cigar counter, where Keyes buys cigars and stuffs them into his pockets. Keyes bites off the end of the cigar, puts it into his mouth, and starts tapping his pockets for a match, as usual. A match is struck by Neff for him before Keyes goes toward the street and out of the scene. The camera follows Neff back into the lobby, and as the elevator is reached by him, he looks back over his shoulder to ensure Keyes is gone, then the empty elevator is stepped into by him, the machine is stopped, and he sits down slowly, still holding the horn. The wall is stared at blankly by Neff, deeply moved.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Neff dials a number in the booth, ensuring no one is watching before hanging up. Phyllis exits the LaSalle in front of the market, enters, and looks around. Neff, appearing calm but tense, walks along the shelves as Phyllis approaches, stopping a couple of feet away. She moves closer, glancing sharply at him, but they part as a customer approaches. Afterward, Phyllis draws near again, gripping Neff's arm, but he pulls away. She removes her dark glasses, looking at him with cold eyes as Neff’s commentary plays. Neff and Lola climb a low hill under a starlit sky with Cesar Franck’s D Minor Symphony from the Bowl. While helping her up, the camera shows the Bowl's filled audience and orchestra. They sit on the grass, Neff nearby but not too close, silhouetted against the lights. Neff lights a cigarette, glancing at her as she cries. After a pause, she cries again, Neff's face reflecting his thoughts as the music plays. Around 5:00 P.M., office workers exit an elevator, including Neff, carrying a briefcase. Heading to the entrance, he hears Keyes, who buys cigars at the counter. Neff lights a match for Keyes, who then leaves. Neff returns to the lobby, checks that Keyes is gone, then steps into an elevator, stops the machine, and sits, emotionally overwhelmed, staring at the wall.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Neff dials a number in the booth, ensuring no one watches before hanging up. The LaSalle arrives, and Phyllis enters the market. Neff, outwardly calm but tense, sees Phyllis approach and stand beside him. They separate as a customer passes, then Phyllis grabs Neff’s arm, but he pulls away. She removes her dark glasses, revealing cold eyes. Neff and Lola climb a hill under a starlit sky, music playing from the Bowl below, packed with an audience. They sit on the grass, Neff near Lola, who starts to cry. At around 5:00 PM, Neff exits the elevator with office workers. Keyes calls Neff over while buying cigars. Neff lights Keyes’ cigar, who then exits. Neff returns to the lobby, checks Keyes is gone, steps into the empty elevator, stops it, and sits, staring blankly at the wall, deeply moved.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Neff finds himself inside the small, confined space of the telephone booth, carefully dialing a number with methodical precision. He glances around cautiously, making sure that no one is watching him before he decides to hang up the phone. Outside, the LaSalle comes to a stop directly in front of the busy market. Phyllis emerges gracefully from the vehicle, entering the bustling market with a watchful eye. Neff moves at a deliberate pace along the aisles, outwardly projecting a sense of calm, but internally, his nerves are tense and on edge. Phyllis appears from beyond his line of sight, approaching him and halting a short distance away, just a couple of feet. She draws nearer, casting a sharp, sideways glance in his direction, but as another customer makes their way down the aisle toward them, they instinctively move apart. Once the customer has passed, Phyllis closes the distance again, taking hold of Neff's arm momentarily, forgetting her surroundings, but he instinctively pulls away. She then removes her dark glasses for the very first time, fixing him with a gaze that is cold and hard, as the expression on Neff's face, as he gazes after her, reflects the commentary that plays over the scene.

Later, Neff and Lola are seen climbing over a low hill in the foreground under a vast, starlit sky, accompanied by the melodious strains of music emanating from the Bowl, where Cesar Franck's D Minor Symphony is being played. As he assists her with her ascent, the camera pans to follow their movements, revealing the expansive view of the Bowl below, filled with a large audience and the orchestra performing within the warmly illuminated shell. They settle down on the grassy area, choosing to sit with Neff positioned nearby but making sure not to intrude on her space, both silhouetted against the bright shell lights. Neff places a cigarette between his lips and strikes a match, casting a glance in her direction as she begins to cry. A brief pause ensues before her tears begin to flow again, as over Neff's face, as he listens intently to the music, comes the same overlay of commentary.

Around 5:00 P.M. or perhaps a little later, a steady stream of office employees is seen emerging from an elevator into the bustling lobby. Among them is Neff, distinctly recognizable as he wears his hat and carries his briefcase. As the camera leads him toward the entrance doors, he is suddenly halted by the familiar voice of Keyes, calling from one side. Neff pauses, turning his attention toward the source of the voice, which leads him in the direction of the cigar counter, where Keyes is busy purchasing cigars and then stuffing them into his pockets. Keyes, in his typical manner, bites off the end of one cigar, places it in his mouth, and starts patting down his pockets for a match, as is his usual habit. In a familiar gesture, Neff strikes a match for him, lighting Keyes' cigar before Keyes makes his way toward the street and exits the scene. Neff then turns back into the lobby, with the camera following close behind, and as he approaches the elevator, he glances back over his shoulder to ensure that Keyes has indeed left. Reassured, he steps into the empty elevator, halts the machine, and gradually sits down, still clutching the horn. Deeply affected, Neff sits there, staring blankly at the elevator wall, lost in contemplation.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Neff finds himself situated within the cramped, confined space of the telephone booth, focusing intently as he carefully dials a number with methodical precision. He takes a moment to glance around cautiously, ensuring that no one is observing him before he ultimately decides to hang up the phone. Outside, the LaSalle comes to a stop, halting directly in front of the lively, bustling market. Phyllis emerges gracefully from the vehicle, stepping into the vibrant market with a watchful, observant eye. Neff makes his way along the aisles at a deliberate pace, outwardly exuding a sense of calm composure, though internally, his nerves are tense and taut, on edge. Phyllis comes into view from beyond his line of sight, approaching him and coming to a stop just a couple of feet away. She draws nearer, casting a sharp, sideways glance in his direction, but as another customer navigates the aisle toward them, they instinctively move apart to avoid any attention. Once the customer has passed them by, Phyllis closes the distance again, momentarily taking hold of Neff's arm, seemingly forgetting her surroundings. Yet, Neff instinctively pulls away. She then makes the decision to remove her dark glasses for the very first time, fixing him with a gaze that is cold and hard. The expression on Neff's face, as he gazes after her, reflects the overlay of commentary that plays over the unfolding scene.

Later on, Neff and Lola are seen making their way up a low hill in the foreground, under the vast, expansive starlit sky, accompanied by the melodious strains of music flowing from the nearby Bowl, where the D Minor Symphony of Cesar Franck is being performed. As Neff assists her with her climb, the camera pans to follow their movements, unveiling the expansive view of the Bowl below, filled with a large audience and the orchestra performing within the warmly illuminated shell. They settle down on the grassy area, choosing a spot to sit where Neff positions himself nearby while ensuring he does not intrude on her space. They sit there, both silhouetted against the bright lights of the shell. Neff places a cigarette between his lips and strikes a match, casting a glance in her direction as she begins to cry. A brief pause ensues before her tears start to flow once more, as over Neff's face, as he listens intently to the music, comes the same overlay of commentary.

Around 5:00 P.M., or perhaps slightly later, a steady stream of office employees can be seen emerging from the elevator into the bustling, lively lobby. Among them is Neff, distinctly recognizable as he wears his hat and carries his briefcase. As the camera leads him toward the entrance doors, he is suddenly brought to a halt by the familiar, distinctive voice of Keyes, calling out from one side. Neff pauses, turning his attention toward the source of the voice, which guides him in the direction of the cigar counter. There, Keyes is busy purchasing cigars and proceeds to stuff them into his pockets. In his typical manner, Keyes bites off the end of one cigar, places it in his mouth, and starts patting down his pockets in search of a match, following his usual habit. In a familiar gesture of assistance, Neff strikes a match for him, lighting Keyes' cigar before Keyes makes his way toward the street and exits the scene. Neff then turns back into the lobby, with the camera following closely behind. As he approaches the elevator, he glances back over his shoulder to ensure that Keyes has indeed departed. Feeling reassured, he steps into the empty elevator, halts the machine, and gradually sits down, still clutching the horn. Deeply affected, Neff remains seated there, staring blankly at the elevator wall, lost in contemplation.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Inside the booth, Neff carefully picks up the receiver and begins dialing a number, his eyes darting around the enclosed space to ensure no one is observing him, and then, feeling assured of his privacy, he gently places the receiver back onto the hook. Outside, the distinct sound of the LaSalle's brakes screeches to a halt in front of the market. Phyllis emerges gracefully from the vehicle with a purposeful air, stepping into the market and scanning her surroundings with a discerning gaze. Meanwhile, Neff navigates the aisles with deliberate slowness, striving to maintain an air of outward calm despite the nervous energy simmering beneath the surface. As Phyllis approaches from a distance, her figure gradually comes into focus until she halts a couple of feet away from him. She edges closer to Neff, throwing him a sharp, sidelong glance heavy with unspoken intent. Their moment is interrupted by the presence of another customer entering the aisle, prompting them to subtly drift apart to maintain the guise of casual shoppers. Once the customer departs, Phyllis instinctively drifts closer again and, in a moment of forgetfulness, clasps Neff's arm, only for him to pull away cautiously. She then removes her dark glasses for the first time, revealing eyes that are cold and piercing, while Neff's face reflects his internal monologue as he watches her leave. Later, under a starlit sky with the evocative strains of Cesar Franck's D Minor Symphony emanating from the Bowl, Neff and Lola climb over a low hill in the foreground. As Neff assists Lola in navigating the incline, the camera pans to capture the expansive view of the Bowl below, vibrant with a packed audience and an orchestra under the illuminated shell. They settle on the grass, with Neff positioning himself close enough to converse yet maintaining a respectful distance, their silhouettes outlined against the shell's lights. Neff deftly places a cigarette between his lips and strikes a match, casting a brief glance at Lola just as she begins to cry softly. After a brief pause, she succumbs to her tears once more, while Neff's expression reveals his internal reflection, influenced by the music's poignant commentary. As the clock nears or slightly surpasses 5:00 P.M., a steady flow of office workers emerges from the elevator and into the lobby, Neff among them, distinct in his hat and briefcase. The camera smoothly leads him toward the entrance doors until he is halted by Keyes' voice emanating from a nearby location. He stops, swivels his head towards the cigar counter, and strides over to Keyes, who is occupied with purchasing cigars and stuffing them into his various pockets. With practiced ease, Keyes bites the end off a cigar, positions it in his mouth, and pats his pockets in search of a match. Neff, anticipating this familiar ritual, strikes a match for him, offering it to Keyes, who then heads towards the street, exiting the scene. Neff retraces his steps into the lobby, the camera trailing his movement, and upon reaching the elevator, he glances back to confirm Keyes' departure before stepping inside. He halts the machine, sinks into a seat, the horn still clutched in his hand, and with a profound sense of emotion, he stares blankly at the wall, lost in thought.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Neff discreetly attempts a call from the booth and scans his surroundings before hanging up. Outside, as the LaSalle arrives at the market, Phyllis exits and enters, glancing around. Neff, appearing calm but internally anxious, peruses the shelves until Phyllis approaches and pauses beside him. They share a brief, tense interaction, interrupted by a passing customer, after which Phyllis resumes her proximity, taking Neff’s arm before he withdraws. She removes her sunglasses, revealing her cold stare as Neff reflects on the encounter. Later, Neff and Lola ascend a hill under the starlit sky, accompanied by Cesar Franck’s D Minor Symphony from the Bowl. They sit on the grass, slightly apart, Neff silhouetted against the shell lights. As he lights a cigarette, Lola begins to cry, inciting a pause before she resumes, while Neff contemplates to the music. Around evening, Neff exits the office with other employees, hat on and briefcase in hand. Approaching the lobby doors, he's halted by Keyes buying cigars. Neff lights Keyes' cigar before Keyes exits to the street. Neff returns to the lobby, checking if Keyes has left, then enters an empty elevator, stops the machine, and sits deeply contemplative, staring at the wall.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Neff is in the booth of a classic diner, a common setting for covert conversations in mid-20th century films, dialing a number and looks around to ensure he is not watched before hanging up. The LaSalle, a luxury automobile produced by General Motors from 1927 to 1940, stops in front of the market, and Phyllis steps out, entering the market known for its abundant fresh produce, and looking around. Neff moves slowly along the shelves, outwardly calm but with his nerves on edge, much like a character in a film noir, as Phyllis approaches from beyond him, stopping beside him a couple of feet away. Phyllis, who is often seen in such dramatic settings, moves close to him and looks at him sharply, sideways, but as a customer comes along the aisle toward them, they move apart to maintain their anonymity. After the customer passes, Phyllis draws close again and takes Neff's arm, forgetting where she is in a moment of vulnerability, but he pulls away. Phyllis takes off her dark glasses for the first time, a common gesture indicating a reveal of true intentions, and looks at him with cold, hard eyes, as over Neff's face, as he looks after her, comes the inner commentary typical of a troubled protagonist. Neff and Lola then climb over a low hill in the foreground under a starlit sky, with music from the Hollywood Bowl, an iconic Los Angeles concert venue, playing Cesar Franck's D Minor Symphony, a piece often associated with passionate intensity. As he helps her climb up, the camera pans with them to show the expanse of the Bowl below, filled with a packed audience and the orchestra on the lighted shell, creating a romantic yet tense atmosphere. They sit down on the grass, with Neff sitting near but not too close to her, silhouetted against the shell lights reminiscent of classic romance scenes. Neff puts a cigarette in his mouth and strikes a match, glancing at her as she begins to cry, a moment underscored by the poignancy of the setting. A pause follows before she starts crying again, while over Neff's face, as he listens to the music, comes the somber commentary. Around 5:00 P.M. or a little later, a stream of office employees comes out of an elevator into the grand lobby typical of corporate America, among them Neff, wearing his brimmed hat and carrying his leather briefcase. As the camera precedes him walking toward the entrance doors, he is stopped by Keyes' voice off to one side, a familiar interruption in their routine. Neff stops, looks towards the cigar counter, a common sight in office building lobbies of the time, and moves toward Keyes, who is buying cigars, a habit illustrating his meticulous nature, and stuffing them into his pockets. Keyes bites off the end of the cigar, puts it into his mouth, and starts tapping his pockets for a match, as usual, a ritualistic action. Neff strikes a match for him, a subtle gesture of camaraderie, before Keyes goes toward the street and out of the scene. Neff moves back into the lobby, followed by the camera, and as he reaches the elevator, he looks back over his shoulder to ensure Keyes is gone, then steps into the empty elevator, stops the machine, and sits down slowly, still holding the horn, a symbolic object adding to the gravity of the moment. Deeply moved by the day's events, Neff sits, staring blankly at the wall, lost in intense contemplation.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Neff puts a cigarette in his mouth and strikes a match glancing at her as she begins to cry. A pause follows before she starts crying again while over Neff's face as he listens to the music comes the commentary. Around 500 PM or a little later a stream of office employees comes out of an elevator into the lobby. among them Neff wearing his hat and carrying his briefcase. As the camera precedes him walking toward the entrance doors he is stopped by Keyes' voice off to one side. Neff stops looks towards the cigar counter and moves toward Keyes who is buying cigars and stuffing them into his pockets. Keyes bites off the end of the cigar puts it into his mouth and starts tapping his pockets for a match. as usual. Neff strikes a match for him before Keyes goes toward the street and out of the scene. Neff moves back into the lobby followed by the camera and as he reaches the elevator he looks back over his shoulder to ensure Keyes is gone then steps into the empty elevator stops the machine and sits down slowly still holding the horn. Deeply moved Neff sits staring blankly at the wall.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Neff is in the booth dialing a number and looks around to ensure he is not watched before hanging up. The LaSalle stops in front of the market and Phyllis steps out entering the market and looking around. Neff moves slowly along the shelves outwardly calm but with his nerves on edge. as Phyllis approaches from beyond him stopping beside him a couple of feet away. Phyllis moves close to him and looks at him sharply sideways but as a customer comes along the aisle toward them they move apart. After the customer passes Phyllis draws close again and takes Neff's arm forgetting where she is but he pulls away. Keyes bites off the end of the cigar puts it into his mouth and starts tapping his pockets for a match. as usual. Neff strikes a match for him before Keyes goes toward the street and out of the scene. Neff moves back into the lobby followed by the camera and as he reaches the elevator he looks back over his shoulder to ensure Keyes is gone then steps into the empty elevator stops the machine and sits down slowly still holding the horn. Deeply moved Neff sits staring blankly at the wall.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Neff is in the booth dialing a number and looks around to ensure he is not watched before hanging up. The LaSalle stops in front of the market and Phyllis steps out entering the market and looking around. Neff moves slowly along the shelves outwardly calm but with his nerves on edge. Neff moves back into the lobby followed by the camera and as he reaches the elevator he looks back over his shoulder to ensure Keyes is gone then steps into the empty elevator stops the machine and sits down slowly still holding the horn. Deeply moved Neff sits staring blankly at the wall.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Neptune is in the booth dialing a number and looks around to ensure the whale is not watched before hanging up. The penguin stops in front of the market, and Balthazar steps out, entering the market and looking around. Neptune moves slowly along the shelves, outwardly calm but with his nerves on edge, as Balthazar approaches from beyond him, stopping beside him a couple of feet away. Balthazar moves close to him and looks at him sharply, sideways, but as a customer comes along the aisle toward them, they move apart. After the customer passes, Balthazar draws close again and takes Neptune's arm, forgetting where the squirrel is, but the squirrel pulls away. Balthazar takes off their dark glasses for the first time and looks at him with cold, hard eyes, as over Neptune's face, as the giraffe looks after the flamingo, comes the commentary. Neptune and Aurora then climb over a low hill in the foreground under a starlit sky, with music from the Bowl playing Cesar Franck's D Minor Symphony. As the goat helps the cat climb up, the camera pans with them to show the expanse of the Bowl below, filled with a packed audience and the orchestra on the lighted shell. They sit down on the grass, with Neptune sitting near but not too close to the elephant, silhouetted against the shell lights. Neptune puts a cigarette in its mouth and strikes a match, glancing at the raccoon as it begins to cry. A pause follows before it starts crying again, while over Neptune's face, as the owl listens to the music, comes the commentary. Around 5:00 P.M. or a little later, a stream of office employees comes out of an elevator into the lobby, among them Neptune, wearing their hat and carrying their briefcase. As the camera precedes the fox walking toward the entrance doors, the fox is stopped by Octavia's voice off to one side. Neptune stops, looks towards the cigar counter, and moves toward Octavia, who is buying cigars and stuffing them into her pockets. Octavia bites off the end of the cigar, puts it into her mouth, and starts tapping her pockets for a match, as usual. Neptune strikes a match for her before Octavia goes toward the street and out of the scene. Neptune moves back into the lobby, followed by the camera, and as the zebra reaches the elevator, it looks back over its shoulder to ensure Octavia is gone, then steps into the empty elevator, stops the machine, and sits down slowly, still holding the horn. Deeply moved, Neptune sits, staring blankly at the wall.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Neff is in the gallery dialing a number and looks around to ensure he is not watched before hanging up. The scooter stops in front of the café, and Phyllis steps out, entering the café and looking around. Neff moves slowly along the paintings, outwardly calm but with his nerves on edge, as Phyllis approaches from beyond him, stopping beside him a couple of seats away. Phyllis moves close to him and looks at him sharply, sideways, but as a vendor comes along the corridor toward them, they move apart. After the vendor passes, Phyllis draws close again and takes Neff's notebook, forgetting where she is, but he pulls away. Phyllis takes off her sun hat for the first time and looks at him with cold, hard eyes, as over Neff's face, as he looks after her, comes the commentary. Neff and Lola then climb over a low dune in the foreground under a sunrise sky, with music from the amphitheater playing Cesar Franck's D Minor Symphony. As he helps her climb up, the camera pans with them to show the expanse of the amphitheater below, filled with a packed audience and the orchestra on the stageside. They sit down on the sand, with Neff sitting near but not too close to her, silhouetted against the stage lights. Neff puts a lollipop in his mouth and strikes a match, glancing at her as she begins to cry. A pause follows before she starts crying again, while over Neff's face, as he listens to the music, comes the commentary. Around 5:00 P.M. or a little later, a stream of office employees comes out of a staircase into the atrium, among them Neff, wearing his hat and carrying his suitcase. As the camera precedes him walking toward the entrance doors, he is stopped by Keyes' voice off to one side. Neff stops, looks towards the chocolate counter, and moves toward Keyes, who is buying chocolates and stuffing them into his pockets. Keyes bites off the wrapper of the chocolate, puts it into his mouth, and starts tapping his pockets for a match, as usual. Neff strikes a match for him before Keyes goes toward the street and out of the scene. Neff moves back into the atrium, followed by the camera, and as he reaches the staircase, he looks back over his shoulder to ensure Keyes is gone, then steps into the empty staircase, stops the machine, and sits down slowly, still holding the flute. Deeply moved, Neff sits, staring blankly at the wall.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Neff is in the booth humming a tune and glances around to ensure he is not recognized before laughing softly. The LaSalle pauses in front of the market, and Phyllis steps out, exiting the market and humming softly. Neff drifts slowly along the shelves, outwardly calm but with his nerves on edge, as Phyllis wanders from beyond him, pausing beside him a couple of feet away. Phyllis leans close to him and glances at him sharply, sideways, but as a customer skips along the aisle toward them, they drift apart. After the customer departs, Phyllis leans close again and pats Neff's arm, pondering where she is, but he steps away. Phyllis removes her dark glasses for the first time and glances at him with cold, hard eyes, as over Neff's face, as he gazes after her, comes the commentary. Neff and Lola then slide over a low hill in the foreground under a starlit sky, with music from the Bowl playing Cesar Franck's D Minor Symphony. As he guides her climb up, the camera pans with them to reveal the expanse of the Bowl below, filled with a packed audience and the orchestra on the lighted shell. They lie down on the grass, with Neff positioned near but not too close to her, silhouetted against the shell lights. Neff places a cigarette in his mouth and flicks a match, glancing at her as she begins to shout. A pause follows before she starts shouting again, while over Neff's face, as he listens to the music, comes the commentary. Around 5:00 P.M. or a little later, a stream of office employees dances out of an elevator into the lobby, among them Neff, wearing his hat and carrying his briefcase. As the camera follows him skipping toward the entrance doors, he is interrupted by Keyes' voice off to one side. Neff pauses, glances towards the cigar counter, and bounces toward Keyes, who is selecting cigars and pocketing them. Keyes breaks off the end of the cigar, places it into his mouth, and starts patting his pockets for a match, as usual. Neff flicks a match for him before Keyes wanders toward the street and out of the scene. Neff bounces back into the lobby, pursued by the camera, and as he reaches the elevator, he glances back over his shoulder to ensure Keyes is gone, then leaps into the empty elevator, pauses the machine, and slumps slowly, still gripping the horn. Deeply moved, Neff slumps, staring vacantly at the wall.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Blender is in the hammock dialing a password and looks around to ensure he is not observed before hanging up. The skateboard stops in front of the library, and Samantha steps out, entering the library and looking around. Blender moves slowly along the hedges, outwardly calm but with his nerves on edge, as Samantha approaches from beyond him, stopping beside him a couple of inches away. Samantha moves close to him and looks at him sharply, sideways, but as a dictionary comes along the corridor toward them, they move apart. After the dictionary passes, Samantha draws close again and takes Blender's shoe, forgetting where she is, but he pulls away. Samantha takes off her dark sunglasses for the first time and looks at him with cold, hard eyes, as over Blender's racecar, as he looks after her, comes the symphony. Blender and Tulip then climb over a low eagle in the foreground under a starlit roof, with music from the Bottle playing Tchaikovsky's D Minor Opera. As he helps her climb up, the camera pans with them to show the expanse of the Bottle below, filled with a packed audience and the orchestra on the lighted sandwich. They sit down on the flag, with Blender sitting near but not too close to her, silhouetted against the sandwich lights. Blender puts a pencil in his mouth and strikes a hammer, glancing at her as she begins to cry. A pause follows before she starts crying again, while over Blender's racecar, as he listens to the opera, comes the symphony. Around 5:00 A.M. or a little later, a stream of soda machines comes out of a bicycle into the jungle, among them Blender, wearing his helmet and carrying his backpack. As the camera precedes him walking toward the entrance swings, he is stopped by Eagle's whistle off to one side. Blender stops, looks towards the popcorn stand, and moves toward Eagle, who is buying popcorn and stuffing them into his envelopes. Eagle bites off the end of the popcorn, puts it into his mouth, and starts tapping his envelopes for a hammer, as usual. Blender strikes a hammer for him before Eagle goes toward the stadium and out of the scene. Blender moves back into the jungle, followed by the camera, and as he reaches the bicycle, he looks back over his shoulder to ensure Eagle is gone, then steps into the empty bicycle, stops the machine, and sits down slowly, still holding the trumpet. Deeply moved, Blender sits, staring blankly at the horizon.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Rodriguez is in the stall sketching a portrait and glances back to ensure he is not spotted before closing the sketchbook. The Ford halts in front of the bakery, and Amelia glides out, entering the bakery and glancing around. Rodriguez shuffles slowly along the aisles, outwardly indifferent but with his focus sharpened, as Amelia drifts in from behind him, pausing beside him a few feet away. Amelia hovers close to him and observes him intently, sideways, but as a shopper approaches down the aisle toward them, they drift apart. After the shopper departs, Amelia shifts close again and grips Rodriguez's shoulder, forgetting where she is, but he pulls away. Amelia removes her scarf for the first time and gazes at him with cold, steely eyes, as over Rodriguez's face, as he watches her leave, comes the narration. Rodriguez and Bella then crawl over a small dune in the foreground under a starlit sky, with music from the Garden playing Beethoven's Moonlight Sonata. As he assists her in climbing up, the camera pans with them to reveal the expanse of the Garden below, filled with a packed audience and the orchestra on the illuminated stage. They recline on the grass, with Rodriguez sitting near but not too close to her, silhouetted against the stage lights. Rodriguez places a lollipop in his mouth and snaps his fingers, glancing at her as she begins to weep. A silence ensues before she starts weeping again, while over Rodriguez's face, as he listens to the music, comes the narration. Around 5:00 P.M. or a little later, a stream of factory workers emerges from a staircase into the lobby, among them Rodriguez, wearing his cap and carrying his satchel. As the camera leads him walking toward the exit doors, he is halted by Dixon's voice off to one side. Rodriguez pauses, looks towards the flower stand, and strides toward Dixon, who is selecting roses and arranging them in his arms. Dixon tears off the wrapper, places it into his pocket, and starts rummaging in his arms for a pen, as usual. Rodriguez hands over a pen for him before Dixon heads toward the avenue and exits the scene. Rodriguez returns into the lobby, followed by the camera, and as he approaches the staircase, he glances back over his shoulder to confirm Dixon is gone, then steps into the unoccupied stairwell, halts the mechanism, and sits down slowly, still clutching the horn. Deeply affected, Rodriguez sits, staring blankly at the wall.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Neff is in the cabin twisting a knob and glances around to ensure he is not overheard before setting the receiver down. The Cadillac halts in front of the bakery, and Phyllis leaps out, entering the bakery and scanning the area. Neff drifts slowly along the corridors, outwardly composed but with his nerves on edge, as Phyllis advances from behind him, pausing beside him several inches away. Phyllis inches close to him and peers at him keenly, sideways, but as a shopper approaches down the hallway toward them, they drift apart. After the shopper moves by, Phyllis sidles close again and grips Neff's shoulder, losing track of her surroundings, but he steps back. Phyllis removes her wide-brimmed hat for the first time and gazes at him with cold, hard eyes, as over Neff's face, as he gazes after her, comes the voiceover. Neff and Lola then scramble over a small dune in the foreground under a moonlit sky, with melodies from the Garden echoing Tchaikovsky's Violin Concerto. As he assists her in climbing up, the camera follows them to reveal the breadth of the Garden below, filled with a dense crowd and the orchestra on the illuminated stage. They recline on the sand, with Neff sitting near but not too close to her, silhouetted against the stage lights. Neff places a lollipop in his mouth and flicks a lighter, casting a glance at her as she begins to laugh. A lull follows before she starts laughing again, while over Neff's face, as he listens to the music, comes the voiceover. Around 5:00 P.M. or slightly later, a stream of office workers steps out of an escalator into the foyer, among them Neff, donning his cap and holding his backpack. As the camera leads him walking toward the exit doors, he is halted by Keyes' voice from one side. Neff pauses, turns towards the candy stall, and strolls toward Keyes, who is purchasing gum and tucking them into his pockets. Keyes nibbles the end of the gum, places it into his mouth, and begins patting his pockets for a lighter, as usual. Neff flicks a lighter for him before Keyes meanders toward the avenue and out of view. Neff drifts back into the foyer, followed by the camera, and as he nears the escalator, he glances back over his shoulder to ensure Keyes is gone, then steps into the empty escalator, halts the contraption, and sits down slowly, still holding the flute. Deeply touched, Neff sits, gazing absently at the ceiling.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Boots scurries through the circus pressing a button and surveys the landscape to ensure he is not spotted before hanging up. The Beetle halts beside the library, and Olivia pops out, entering the library and scanning the area. Boots drifts quickly along the benches, outwardly serene but with his thoughts on edge, as Olivia progresses behind him, pausing near him a couple of steps away. Olivia slides close to him and glares at him intensely, sideways, but as a gardener ambles down the path toward them, they drift apart. After the gardener departs, Olivia leans in once more and links Boots's elbow, forgetting where she is, but he shrugs away. Olivia removes her red spectacles for the first time and glares at him with icy, piercing eyes, as over Boots's expression, as he watches her depart, comes the narration. Boots and Marge then scramble over a tiny mound in the foreground under a moonlit expanse, with tunes from the Valley echoing Mahler's Fifth Symphony. As he assists her ascent, the lens moves with them to reveal the spread of the Valley below, brimming with a crowded gathering and the ensemble on the glowing stage. They settle down on the sand, with Boots reclining near but not too close to her, silhouetted against the stage lights. Boots puts a lollipop in his mouth and strikes a flint, peeking at her as she begins to weep. A lull ensues before she resumes sobbing, while over Boots's expression, as he absorbs the melody, comes the narration. Around 3:00 A.M. or a bit later, a wave of warehouse technicians spills out of a staircase into the parlor, among them Boots, donning his cap and clutching his backpack. As the lens shadows him pacing toward the portal doors, he is halted by Blume's voice off to one side. Boots halts, peers towards the candy counter, and glides toward Blume, who is purchasing gumdrops and cramming them into his sleeves. Blume nibbles off the end of the gumdrop, inserts it into his mouth, and begins patting his sleeves for a flint, as usual. Boots strikes a flint for him before Blume ambles toward the avenue and out of the scene. Boots glides back into the parlor, trailed by the lens, and as he approaches the staircase, he glances back over his shoulder to ensure Blume is absent, then enters the vacant staircase, halts the apparatus, and reclines slowly, still holding the whistle. Deeply touched, Boots sits, gazing blankly at the ceiling.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Neff is discreetly making a phone call in a booth. Meanwhile, Phyllis exits a LaSalle in front of a market, searching for Neff, who appears calm but is tense inside. They briefly connect, but separate when a customer approaches. After Phyllis removes her glasses, revealing cold eyes, Neff reflects on their interaction. Later, Neff and Lola climb a hill under a starlit sky with music playing from the Bowl below. As they sit on the grass, Neff lights a cigarette and Lola begins to cry. Around 5:00 P.M., Neff exits an office elevator with a briefcase and is stopped by Keyes. Neff lights Keyes' cigar before Keyes leaves. Neff then returns to the lobby, checks for Keyes, and enters an empty elevator, stopping it and sitting down, lost in thought.
